entry.et: Middle English, from Anglo-French, from Latin praejudicium previous judgment, damage, from prae- + judicium judgment judicial

def.dt: :injury or damage resulting from some judgment or action of another in disregard of one's rights
:detriment to one's legal rights or claims
:an adverse opinion or leaning formed without just grounds or before sufficient knowledge
:an instance of such judgment or opinion
:an irrational attitude of hostility directed against an individual, a group, a race, or their supposed characteristics
:to injure or damage by some judgment or action (as in a case of law)
